CRYO VAULT JAKE'S POV -- A TECH in medical scrubs FLOATS WEIGHTLESSLY toward us. Wherever we are, we're not on Earth. Jake squints as the lights flicker on, revealing -- WIDE SHOT -- the multi-tiered CRYO VAULT. Hundreds of CRYO- CAPSULES are opening like morgue drawers, as med techs pull themselves about in ZERO-G, tending to their patients.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: People, you have been in cryo for five years, nine months and twenty two days. You will be hungry, you will be weak. If you feel nausea, please use the sacks provided for your convenience. The staff thanks you in advance.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Against the cold infinity   of stars glides an INTERSTELLAR SPACECRAFT -- ISV VENTURE   STAR. As it moves past like an endless train, we realize   this thing is ENORMOUS -- over half a mile long. PAN WITH IT    180 to REVEAL -- A GAS-GIANT PLANET called POLYPHEMUS, ringed with dozens of moons which cast beauty-mark shadows on its vast face. The ISV diminishes away from us toward the largest MOON-- a blue and surprisingly Earth-like world called PANDORA. The ship dwindles to a speck against the BLUE MOON.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . PANDORA ORBIT ISV Venture Star drifts above a spectacular vista -- the sapphire seas and unfamiliar continents of Pandora.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: two massive "VALKYRIE" SHUTTLES are mated to a DOCKING NODE. One of them separates from the starship and moves away, its thrusters FIRING in short bursts. As the shuttle moves away, descending toward Pandora, we hear the sound of DRUMS, building, louder and louder until we--

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: of massive cliffs and towering mesas carpeted in rainforest. Great scarves of cloud swirl around the mesa tops. A primeval landscape, vast and forbidding. The trees are alien, the color too cyan. There are waterfalls, rivers, and distant flocks of WINGED CREATURES. Suddenly the carpet of virgin rainforest gives way to -- AN OPEN-PIT MINE. A lifeless crater -- as if a giant cookie- cutter took a chunk out of the world. Down among the terraces are EXCAVATORS and TRUCKS the size of three story buildings. And beyond the mine is the HUMAN COLONY -- 7.

At the corners are towers with automated SENTRY GUNS swiveling on servo mounts. Visible beyond the gun towers, the VALKYRIE SHUTTLE roars in across the treetops. VECTORING NOZZLES change angle, bringing the ship to a SLOW HOVER.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Through a screen of jungle canopy, we see the VALKYRIE thunder overhead. Camera TILTS with it until leaves block the view.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The crew chief stops by Jake long enough to bark -- CREW CHIEF Exopack on, let's go!

dialogue.name: dialogue

Without his mask, we see that Quaritch's features are rugged and handsome, except for the SCAR, which runs from scalp to jaw down one side of his face. On one hip he carries a very large PISTOL.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Out beyond that fence every living thing that crawls, flies or squats in the mud wants to kill you and eat your eyes for jujubees.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: We have an indigenous population of humanoids here called the Na'vi. They're fond of arrows dipped in a neurotoxin which can stop your heart in one minute. We operate -- we live -- at a constant threat condition yellow.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you're Jake right? Tom's brother? You look just like him. (off Jake's wary look) Sorry, I'm Norm Spellman, I went through avatar training with him.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: He was a great guy -- funny.     It was a big shock to all of us.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: And duh! -- obviously you look like him. I mean, if you weren't genetically identical, you wouldn't be taking over his avatar.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's why I'm here.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So -- you want to go check it out?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: enter the BIO-LAB -- a large lab complex with many adjoining rooms.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: A scientist, DOCTOR MAX CULLIMORE, is supervising the uncrating of two SHIPPING CONTAINERS. The nearer has the sides removed, revealing -- a ceiling-height acrylic TANK. Norm stops to stare, and Jake rolls past him as if drawn by some unseen force, toward -- THE AMNIO TANK. There is a FIGURE floating lanquidly inside, which looks like a man. A very large, very blue, man. Blood circulates through a synthetic UMBILICAL in the abdomen. As the figure turns in the amniotic fluid, we see that it has a lemur-like TAIL. The skin is cyan-blue. Long black hair drifts, graceful as seaweed.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Me and Norm were out here to drive these remotely controlled bodies called avatars. They're grown from human DNA mixed with DNA from the natives here.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Damn.   They got big.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, they mature on the trip out. (to Max) So the proprioceptive sims worked pretty well.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, they've got great muscle tone. Give us a few hours, you guys can take them for a spin.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: sleeping face turns toward us, and the features are -- despite feline ears and a long feral snout -- definitely JAKE'S.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It looks like him.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No, it looks like you.   This is your avatar now, Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: mesmerized as he stares into the tank.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: STEREOCAM VIDEO SHOT OF JAKE -- facing the camera, talking directly to the lens. JAKE'S VOICE-OVER up until now has been part of this VIDEOLOG.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The idea is -- every driver is matched to his own avatar --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: so their nervous systems are in tune. Or something. Which is why they offered me this gig, because I can link with Tommy's avatar, which was insanely expensive. (looking off camera) Is this right? I just say whatever in these videologs?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He leads Jake and Norm through the short corridor to the -- CUT TO:

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. You just need to get in the habit of documenting everything -- what you see, what you feel -- it's all part of the science. Good science starts with good observation.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Right. (to camera) So, whatever. Here I am. Doing science. (looks around) Never been in a lab before.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Log off. It's time to meet your boss for the next five years.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The LINK ROOM contains a dozen PSIONIC LINK UNITS, which look like coffins crossed with MRI scanners.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Grace Augustine is a legend. She's the head of the Avatar Program, and she wrote the book -- I mean literally wrote the book -- on Pandoran botany.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (low, over his shoulder) That's because she likes plants better than people.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . GRACE AUGUSTINE sits up in her link, stretching and cracking her neck after a long session. She's fifty, with a strong face and fiercely intelligent eyes.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who's got my goddamn cigarette?!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: scurries to bring it to her, already lit.   Around here they jump when Grace barks. Grace stands, scowling, as Jake, Norm and Max approach.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace nods approvingly, taking a drag on her cigarette.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake waits while they ignore him, chattering in fluent Na'vi.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace wheels on Max.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . She shoves past Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: But she's already out the door and clomping down the corridor. Max turns to Jake with a pained look.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: And here she is, Cinderella back from the ball. Grace, I'd like you to meet Norm Spellman and Ja -- GRACE Norm. I hear good things about you. How's your Na'vi?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (Na'vi, subtitled) May the All Mother smile upon our first meeting.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Not bad. You sound a little formal.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: There is still much to learn.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Grace, this is Jake S---- GRACE (turning to Jake) Yeah, yeah, I know who you are, and I don't need you. I need your brother. (to Max) You know -- the PhD who trained three years for this mission.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: He's dead. I know it's a big inconvenience to everyone.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How much lab training have you had?   Ever run a gas chromatograph?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Any actual lab work at all?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: High school chemistry.   But I ditched.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You see? You see? They're pissing on us without even the courtesy of calling it rain. (turning away) I'm going to Selfridge.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Grace, that's not a good idea.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Here, tomorrow, oh eight hundred.   Try to use big words.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: It looks like an air-traffic control tower, with lots of screens and bay windows showing the whole complex.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: takes a ball from a newly opened case of TITLEISTS and sets it on the floor. Selfridge is young, charismatic, focused. Some would say ruthless. He assumes the stance and lines up his putt, toward a practice cup across the control room floor. He glances up as Grace strides toward him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Selfridge looks down and hits the ball. Grace kicks the practice cup aside, and the ball rolls past. Selfridge looks at her with a sigh.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: As Selfridge saunters over to retrieve the ball -- 16.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Selfridge crosses to his office, behind a glass wall nearby. Grace follows.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: On Selfridge's desk is a magnetic base, and hovering in mid- air, in the invisible field, is a lump of METALLIC ROCK. Pure UNOBTANIUM. He grabs it and holds it up between thumb and forefinger, in front of Grace's eyes.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He places it back in the magnetic field.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Parker, I used to think it was benign neglect, but now I see you're intentionally screwing us.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Grace.   You know I enjoy our little talks.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I need a research assistant, not some jarhead dropout.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Actually, we got lucky with him.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Lucky?   How is this in any way lucky?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Well -- lucky your guy had a twin brother, and lucky the brother wasn't an oral hygienist or something. A Marine we can use. I'm assigning him to your team as security escort.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The last thing I need is another trigger happy asshole out there!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Look, you're supposed to be winning the hearts and minds of the natives. Isn't that the whole point of your little puppet show? If you look like them, if you talk like them, they'll trust you?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: But after -- how many years? -- relations with the indigenous are only getting worse.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That tends to happen when you use machine guns on them.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: This is why we're here. Unobtanium. Because this little gray rock sells for twenty million a kilo. No other reason. This is what pays for the party. And it's what pays for your science. Comprendo?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Those savages are threatening our whole operation. We're on the brink of war and you're supposed to be finding a diplomatic solution. So use what you've got and get me some results.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: and JAKE approach their link units. Jake glances through a PRESSURE WINDOW. In an adjoining chamber (the AMBIENT ROOM) JAKE'S AVATAR lies on a gurney, breathing slowly in PANDORAN AIR. NORM'S AVATAR is on a second gurney. Both are attended by med techs in exo-masks. Norm slips into his LINK CHAIR, expertly donning biometric sensors.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace looks pointedly at Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace opens the hood of Jake's link unit. Jake starts hauling himself across from his wheelchair. She reaches to help him but -- JAKE Don't!   I got this. Grace steps back, hands raised.    He drags himself into the unit.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He meets her eyes with a defiant glare.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace watches him laboriously pull his inert legs into the link chair by hand.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . Jake settles into the warm fluid gel packs lining the unit. It seems to enfold him. Grace adjusts his biometric sensors, then lowers the UPPER CLAMSHELL -- GRACE Relax and let your mind go blank.    That shouldn't be hard for you.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: But the SLAMMING HOOD muffles the rest.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The LINK TECH touches some controls.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How much link time have you logged?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Five hundred and twenty hours.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Like -- an hour.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Tell me you're joking.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So you just figured you'd come out here to the most hostile environment known to man, with no training of any kind, and see how it went? What was going through your head?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I was just tired of doctors telling me what I couldn't do.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Kiss the darkest part of my lily white --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Initiate link.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: a 3D SCAN of Jake's brain appears. Regions of activity flow with complex shifting colors.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Max watches a display showing the avatar's nervous system aligning with Jake's -- two ghostly networks of light merging.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's a gorgeous brain.     Nice activity.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Go figure. (walking away) Alright, I'm going in.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Phase-lock at forty percent.    He's in transition.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's it.     Find your way home.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: inside the link unit. His eyes move under the lids, like a dreamer in REM sleep as -- INSIDE JAKE'S MIND -- radiant streamers coalesce into a pulsing TUNNEL OF LIGHT and -- THE SCREEN FLARES WHITE -- ZZZWHAP! -- resolving into an overexposed, out-of-focus image -- two BLURRY FACES wearing masks, looking down.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: two very intense eyes FILL FRAME, the pupils contracting. Golden irises pulse with life.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Blinking, Jake slowly sits up on the gurney. He looks down at his AVATAR BODY, touching his chest with one hand.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: But Jake isn't listening. He's staring at his legs.     He eases them off the gurney and -- HIS BLUE FEET touch the concrete floor, taking his weight.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: He's in.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Phase-lock ninety nine percent. The link is stable.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Take it slow, Jake. We need to check your motor control. Try touching your fingertips together --

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: feeling the strength in his legs.    His expression is child-like with wonder.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: -- looking down at the med techs, who seem the size of children next to his 9' tall frame. He sees something like a blue tentacle curl across his arm and he JERKS AROUND in alarm. HIS TAIL. As he turns to see it, the tail sweeps instruments off a table with a crash. Jake laughs and grins at Max.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: But Jake takes a step, then another. The wires to the bio- monitors pull taut, and he yanks them off his chest.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: But Jake pushes past the protesting med techs, toward the door and -- EXT. AVATAR COMPOUND - DAY Jake emerges, blinking in the morning sun. He finds himself in the AVATAR COMPOUND -- a living and training area. Nearby, a couple of AVATARS are playing one-on-one in front of a (non-regulation height) basketball net. Others go about their daily activities around the compound.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . Jake flexes his legs -- JUMPS -- and lands a little unsteadily, but his expression is joyful. He takes a few steps and breaks into a RUN. People are calling to him, somehwere, but he doesn't hear them -- he's running. RUNNING! He finds himself in the COMPOUND GARDEN, and stops amid neatly tended rows of ALIEN PLANTS. He looks down, wiggling his toes in the warm soil. Then inhales deeply -- revelling in the alien smells -- earth, plants, the nearby forest. He looks at his bare footprint in the soil of an alien world.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake turns at the familiar voice to see -- A statuesque FEMALE AVATAR walking toward him. AVATAR GRACE is magnificent, with panther thighs, flat muscular stomach and firm athlete's breasts. She wears shorts and a T-shirt. In human years she would be about 35.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She throws him a piece of Pandoran fruit, which he catches.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake bites into the fruit, the juice running down his chin.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake turns to see NORM'S AVATAR posing like a bodybuilder -- chest shot, back shot, bi's.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Easy, Jake, I need you to sit down --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Jake! Wait, we have to run some tests --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey Marine!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Grace?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Well who'd you expect, numbnuts?   Think fast!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Motor control is looking good.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, check it out.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I am a living god.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: of the terraced crater of the UNOBTANIUM MINE.    A quiet beat, then -- 21.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ! The entire face of one terrace is blown skyward in a chain of EXPLOSIONS. The "shot" blasts hundreds of tons of rock loose.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: S of enormous WHEEL-LOADERS shovelling up ore- rich rock and dropping it into DUMP TRUCKS.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: A wall of steel FILLS FRAME. The DOZER BLADE crushes everything in its path, reducing trees to kindling.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: R, showing the CLEAR-CUTTING operation near the mine, as a road is cut through the jungle. Remotely operated DOZERS three stories tall rip into the tree-line. One of the dozers has rotating SLASH-CUTTER, a vicious spinning head, mounted on a hydraulic arm, that hogs through the enormous tree trunks in a spray of wood-shrapnel. The heavy machines are escorted by AMPSUITS. COLONEL QUARITCH, on foot, leads a squad of troopers wearing breathing masks and carrying almighty big AUTOMATIC WEAPONS.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: a fearsome aerial predator -- HURTLES from above, diving toward them on wings 3 meters across. We get a glimpse of glassy fangs before -- P-P-POOM! Quaritch cranks off three rapid SHOTS with his massive sidearm, and the creature drops with a SHRIEK. It crashes near them and Quaritch FIRES two more well placed rounds. The newbies stare at the thing's barracuda teeth.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . Quaritch leads his squad into the gloom of the forest, his eyes scanning. Flanking the squad, LYLE WAINFLEET drives an

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: For you pogues, this is a banshee. A small one. See, they like it when I bring fresh meat out here. And this clearcutting really stirs up the hornet's nest. So keep your head on a swivel. If it moves, shoot it. If you're not sure it's moving -- shoot it! If it looks like a bunch of flowers you want to take home to Sally Rottencrotch -- SHOOT IT! What're you gonna do?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Shoot it, sir!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Outstanding. Let's roll.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: his massive feet CRASHING through the underbrush. As his gaze comes down, he sees something ahead of him on the trail -- an intricate TOTEM of woven sticks, bones and feathers hanging across the trail like an orb-weaver's web. He tears it down with the barrel of his rifle, and stomps it into the mud as he moves on.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake sits on a wooden bed in a long hut of tropical-style construction -- beamed ceiling, open sides covered by screen. Around him the other avatars are bedding down for the night, pulling insect netting around their cots. In one hand, Jake holds the end of his long braided QUEUE of hair.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ON the queue -- the ends of the hair writhe slowly with their own life, like tendrils of a sea creature.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's kinda freaky.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: switches off the overheads.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake sits in the twilight, listening to the SCREECHES and

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Lights out amigos.     See ya' at dinner.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: from the forest. Finally he lies down, CLOSING HIS EYES and -- INT. LINK ROOM - NIGHT ECU HUMAN JAKE -- his eyes OPEN. Jake blinks, disoriented, as Max opens the upper clamshell of his link unit. In the next chair Grace sits up, yawning and cracking her neck as the scared tech runs to her with a lit cigarette.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (looking down) Damn. Same old sack a' bones.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: struggles with the dead weight of his legs as he hauls himself out of the unit.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: sits with GRACE, NORM and the other avatar "drivers", while around them miners, troopers and other base personnel wolf their breakfasts. Grace is engaged in a heated conversation with another SCIENTIST. Jake, isolated from the conversations around him, notices -- PILOT TRUDY CHACON approaching, dressed in her flight suit. She's a rock-hard former Marine with thousands of flight hours out in the badlands.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake gives Norm a puzzled glance and pivots from the table. He wheels away, led by Trudy.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Sully -- Colonel wants to see you in the Armor Bay.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: scowling as she watches him go.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: enter the ARMOR BAY, passing TILT-ROTORS under repair. There are the heavily armed SCORPIONS as well as several SA-2 SAMSON work-horses outfitted with door guns and rocket pods.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She extends her fist and he taps it with his.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake rolls his chair along the central gallery of the Armor Bay, passing rows of AMPSUITS standing in service racks. Techs clamber over the `suits, loading ordinance with cranes and lifts.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . At the end of the row is a makeshift GYM area.   QUARITCH is bench-pressing massive plates.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Quaritch racks the bar and sits up, sweating but not winded.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Quaritch chuckles appreciatively, claps him on the shoulder. The CHIEF MECHANIC yells from the nearest AMPSUIT -- MECHANIC That servo's in, Colonel, if you want to try it. Quaritch crosses to the `suit, with Jake following.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He points to his scarred face.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He looks out, as if he can see through the wall to the tree- line.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Quaritch climbs the `suit and reaches into the cockpit, throwing some switches. The `suit's gas-turbine spools up with a rising WHINE.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The WHINE is now a roaring WHOOSH as the `suit trembles with power. The air boils above the exhaust vents. Quaritch reaches in and operates the controls, flexing one huge hand. He nods to the waiting mechanic -- QUARITCH Looks good. (to Jake) I need you to learn about these savages, gain their trust. Find out how I can force their cooperation, or hit `em hard if they don't. Maybe you can keep some of my boys from going home like you. Or bagged-and-tagged.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake nods. Quaritch brings the `suit to life. He steps forward and pivots smoothly. He balances the two ton machine on one foot while sweeping the arms in strong, graceful arcs. Jake realizes he is doing a WU-SHOO KATA. A flawless display of strength and control. He's impressive, and Jake is impressed. Quaritch is the kind of man he respects -- focused, hard. Determined.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He raises the `suit's hand, and slams the canopy shut like the visor of a helmet. Jake watches Quaritch walk past, huge feet CLANGING -- KUNG! KUNG! KUNG!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You guys're packing some heavy ordinance.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, `cause we're not the only thing flyin' around out there. Or the biggest. I'm gonna need you on a door gun, I'm a man short.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, no problem.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: See ya on the flight-line, zero nine. (she points) He's down there.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: This low gravity makes you soft. (pushing the last rep) You get soft, Pandora will shit you out dead with zero warning.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I pulled your record, Corporal. Venezuela

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: that was some mean bush. Nothing like this here, though. You got heart kid, coming out here.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I figured -- just another hellhole.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I was in First Recon a few years ahead of you. More than a few. Two tours in Nigeria, not a scratch. I come out here and --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: They could fix this if I rotated back. But you know what? I kinda like it. Reminds me every day what's out there. Besides, I can't leave --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: This is my war, here.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The avatar program is a joke -- buncha limpdick scientists. But we have a unique opportunity here, you and I. A recon Marine in an avatar body could get me the intel I need, on the ground, right in the hostiles' camp.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That sounds real good, Colonel.   So -- am I still with Augustine?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: On paper. You walk like one of her science pukes, you quack like one, but you report to me. Can you do that for me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Look, son -- I take care of my own. Get me what I need, I'll see you get your legs back when you rotate home. Your real legs.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: is on the move, gulping coffee, in a hurry to get their

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: started. She hands a clipboard to MAX.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Max nods and jogs ahead toward the LINK ROOM. JAKE and NORM fall in with Grace as they enter the CONNECTING CORRIDOR.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She stops, turning to drill him with a look.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She turns and enters the LINK ROOM.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Start calibrating. We're on the flight line in ten minutes.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What did Atilla want?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Just Marines comparin' tattoos.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (not buying it) Yeah. Well, listen to me, Marine --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: you're driving an avatar, now.     That means you're in my world, got it?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Got it.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace crosses to the controls of Jake's LINK UNIT. As the others catch up -- GRACE That son of a bitch has screwed up this program enough. All this -- (indicating link room)

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake hauls himself across from wheelchair to link.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake lies back, lowering the sensor array over his body.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She closes his clamshell, HARD, and we -- CUT TO:

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: exists so we can go out there and build a bridge of trust to these people, who could teach us so much. But thanks to Quaritch and his thugs the Na'vi won't even talk to us anymore.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Then how's this supposed to work?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: We have a new face. (turning to Norm) You're fluent, you've studied the culture. You're non-threatening. The ones we know best -- the Omaticaya clan -- may give you a chance. Maybe you can get them back to the table before things go tits-up for good.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: This is failing as a pep talk.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How do we contact them?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: We don't. They contact us. If they see us taking our samples, treating the forest with respect -- (pointedly to Jake) Not trampling everything in sight -- they may reach out to us.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Or they may skin us and make a drum.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Just keep your mouth shut and let Norm do the talking.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . RAIN FOREST / AERIAL - DAY FLYING over a carpet of rainforest, past sheer cliffs and cloud-wreathed mesas. TRUDY'S SAMSON TILT-ROTOR chases its shadow across the treetops. Though big as a Blackhawk, it is tiny in the vast primeval landscape.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: THROUGH the open side doors of the Samson. Trooper

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: in exo-mask and body armor, leans on his door gun, scanning for aerial predators. In avatar form JAKE, GRACE and NORM watch the forest unrolling beneath them, the wind blasting their clothes. Jake mans the other door gun, his feet propped on the skids.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: flies from a pressurized cockpit. She banks to follow a shallow river.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Norm grins and points, excitedly. Jake looks in time to see-- A herd of STURMBEEST -- massive six-legged creatures reminiscent of buffalo -- thundering across the river.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace nods approvingly.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Sturmbeest herd, one o'clock.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Looks like a bull, six cows and some juveniles.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The bull has the red on the dorsal armor?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Hundreds of purple winged creatures take flight from a lake, startled by the Samson. They skim the water above their own reflections. TETRAPTERONS.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: the ground drops away as the Samson flies over a

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: hundreds of feet high. Trudy banks hard, rolling in on the gorge below like it's a gun-run. Wainfleet WHOOPS while Norm looks like he's about to puke.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake grins into the airstream.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yo Chacon!     Get some!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: A small meadow among towering trees. The fern-like "grass" is beaten down in waves by the rotor-wash as the Samson settles to the ground. Jake pulls the massive door gun off its pintle mount and hefts it like an assault rifle. He and Wainfleet leap out to secure the LZ, scanning the tree- line warily, weapons aimed. Grace jogs forward to the cockpit, motioning Trudy to shut down. Trudy kills the Samson's TURBINES. Grace, towering over Wainfleet, motions him to hang back.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake takes point as they enter the jungle.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Stay with the ship. (for Jake) One idiot with a gun's enough.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Whatever you say, Doc.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Ya'll have fun out there.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The forest engulfs JAKE, GRACE and NORM in cyan gloom. The shadows are alive with the CHITTERING sounds of unseen alien wildlife.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: as he moves through the foliage, hyper- alert -- looking around like a tourist in Hell.A monkey-like

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: leaping from limb to limb overhead, flashing through the sunlight streaming down in shafts.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: with swaying tendrils which reach toward Jake as he passes. This forest is more alive than any on Earth, with plants that react and move like animals. Jake white-knuckles his rifle as if every shadow conceals razor-fanged death.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She pushes ahead of him on the trail, forcing him to lower his muzzle as he follows her. Grace moves nimbly on the path, seemingly unconcerned.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Relax, Marine. You're making me nervous.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . FOREST/ GLEN WIDE SHOT as the party moves between the huge trees, tiny as ants. The trail has gotten steeper, the going tougher.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: They enter a clearing with an OVERGROWN BUILDING made of timbers cut from the local trees, with a thatch roof. It is covered with vines as the jungle reclaims it.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Norm gulps. Jake looks behind him as they approach the school, feeling unseen eyes.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How will they know we're here?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure they're watching us right now.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL RUINS TRACKING WITH JAKE'S BOOTS as he steps among dried leaves and a few moldering CHILDREN'S BOOKS. Floorboards CREAK.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The kids were so bright, so eager to learn... they picked up English faster than I could teach it to them.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: R as Jake explores the room. Grace and Norm are selecting

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: from storage cases on a wooden table.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake looks up at a RUSTLING among the dark rafters. Roosting

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Bring the soil probe -- right there, yellow case.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: eye him warily, fluttering their wings. Grace picks up a moldering copy of "The Lorax" by Dr. Seuss from the floor and puts it back on a shelf.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake sees something, and approaches the blackboard -- reaches out to touch a pattern of holes blasted into the slate. Unmistakably BULLET HOLES.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She turns away.   Jake watches her as he jams equipment into his pack.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The stingbats knock them off. I guess I always hope somebody will come back and read them.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why don't they come back?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The Na'vi learned as much about us as they needed to know.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (turning to her) What happened here?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Are you going to help with this gear? We've got a lot to do.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ON Grace's blue hand gently brushing away soil, exposing a tangle of ROOT TENDRILS.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: See, right here where the roots of the two trees interact.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: R -- GRACE and NORM crouch among enormous octopoidal roots. She takes a tiny sample using a needle-like probe. Norm uses a digital DEVICE to scan the roots.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: bored, scouts ahead a few meters. He comes to a GLADE filled with shoulder-high SPIRAL PLANTS called HELICORADIANS. He BRUSHES one and SHTOONK! -- it SUCKS DOWN into a tube in the ground so quickly it seems to simply vanish. Curious, Jake touches another -- SHTOONK! And another -- like popping balloons after a party. SHTOONK! SHTOONK!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ! A chain reaction begins and the whole colony pulls down into the ground, REVEALING -- A HAMMERHEAD TITANOTHERE. Like a six-legged rhinoceros, but twice that size. Its massive, low-slung head has projections of bone giving it the look of a hammerhead shark. Its baleful eyes lock onto him.   Jake raises his rifle. Grace, alerted by the creature's SNORTS, runs to where she can see the tableau. She presses her THROAT MIKE.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . The bull HAMMERHEAD bellows and lowers its 3 meter wide sledgehammer of a skull.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake starts to back away.   The hammerhead bellows again, pawing the earth.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The hammerhead SLASHES its head sideways, splintering saplings. It bellows again, lowers its head and CHARGES -- Jake SCREAMS at the top of his lungs, spreads his arms wide and runs straight at the thing. It STOPS abruptly, with an oversized BLEAT.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Don't shoot. You'll piss it off.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's already pissed off!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Jake, that armor's too thick. Trust me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's a territorial threat display. Do not run, or he'll charge.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What do I do?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Hold your ground!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: amazed the gambit worked.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah!   Who's bad?! That's right.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: rises up behind him out of focus -- A THANATOR. The most awesome land predator the universe has ever conceived This thing could eat a T-rex and have the Alien for desert. It is a black six-limbed panther from Hell, with an armored head and massive distensible jaws.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: unaware of the advancing thanator, is still bracing the hammerhead -- JAKE That's what I'm talkin' about, bitch! The bull wheels around, TRUMPETING in fear, and CRASHES away through splintering undergrowth.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: A guttural SNARL behind him. Jake spins in time to see -- THREE TONS of rippling thanator LAUNCH over him, landing between him and the hammerhead. The ground shakes. The thanator emits an earsplitting ROAR, enraged that the hammerhead got away. It twists on itself, turning to face Jake, and bares its fangs with a lethal HISS.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Run, don't run? What?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake BOLTS as -- The thanator LEAPS after him and -- Jake launches himself between two large trunks, forcing the beast to claw its way around to the side while -- Jake scrambles up -- around -- over a tangle of roots and -- SK-RASH!! CLAWS SLASH the air behind him, EXPLODING bark off a trunk as -- JAKE wills himself forward in a frenzy. With rippling muscle the beast is airborne again, blacking out the sun but -- JAKE dives under a massive root system, and -- CRASH! Kindling rains around him as the beast tears into the root-trunks above him. Claws SLASH down next to him as he rolls and crawls -- Glistening jaws SMASH and SNAP against the barrier trunks, sending chunks of wood flying. It's spittle sprays across Jake, jaws inches away as -- He rolls onto his back, and FIRES his AR point blank but the rifle is SNATCHED out of his hands. The beast SCREECHES an ungodly WAIL of pain and rage and -- RIPS the ENTIRE TRUNK away. Jake scrambles to escape but -- GLISTENING JAWS lunge downward, SNAP SHUT and -- The creature rips Jake out of the tree, shaking him like a junkyard dog with a rabbit, only -- 34. It has him by the BACKPACK, so Jake unlatches it and -- He FLIES FREE as the thanator crushes the pack with its teeth. Giving Jake a moment to sprint away, but -- With a hideous BELLOW the thanator crashes after him, splintering trees.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's right motherf--

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What about this one?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Run.     Definitely RUN!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: in a blur, dodging between trunks as a glistening black tornado shreds the forest behind him and -- He sees WATER ahead and DIVES OUTWARD with all his might -- The thanator's jaws SNAP SHUT inches behind him as he flies out into open space and -- JAKE SPLASHES down into a swiftly moving river. The thanator LEAPS DOWN AFTER HIM, pursuing from rock to rock, its claws swiping like a grizzly fishing for salmon. Jake ducks under as -- FWHOOSH! -- black claws SLASH past his face amid turbulent bubbles.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ahead. Jake is swept over the falls, with the thanator SWIPING at him from a rock, just MISSING and -- Jake disappears down the throat of the thundering cataract.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The water boils below the cataract. Jake's head bursts through the surface, and he gasps for breath. He is carried along by the current, but manages to grab a limb on a fallen tree. He weakly pulls himself up, and just lies there gasping on the trunk. Above him, on the cliff, the THANATOR BELLOWS, a roar which echoes across the jungle.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: wet and bruised, crouches under a screen of giant leaves.   He hacks manically at the end of a cut sapling with his knife, forming a crude but sharp tip.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: with Jake as he walks through the forest like it's a minefield, carrying his SPEAR white-knuckled. He is freaked and hyper-alert.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . The trees here are a hundred meters high, blocking out the sky. A few pencil beams of sunlight filter down into the cyan gloom.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: looking down through leaves we watch Jake move warily through the forest.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: bright in the shadows.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: as Jake passes under a tree limb. Invisible to him, draped on the limb like a leopard, is a striking NA'VI GIRL. She watches, only her eyes moving. She is lithe as a cat, with a long neck, muscular shoulders, and nubile breasts. And she is devastatingly beautiful -- for a girl with a tail. In human age she would be 18. Her name is NEYTIRI(nay-Tee-ree). Jake passes less than 2 meters beneath her, oblivious.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: rises soundlessly. In one fluid, sinuous movement she NOCKS an arrow to her BOW and DRAWS, aiming RIGHT AT JAKE. Utterly silent. Below her Jake is totally unaware of the arrow aimed at his

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: as she follows him with the bow, muscles tensing for the shot -- -- and SOMETHING drifts down in front of her, F.G.    She hesitates.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: to the tip of the arrow -- where a single

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: floats down to land on the arrow-head.Like a dandelion seed, but larger, the WOODSPRITE waves its silky

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: feather light, as it balances on the deadly point. It glows faintly in the dark shadows.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: frowns, puzzled, and LOWERS her bow slowly.   The woodsprite WHIRLS away into the gloom.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: and NORM peer down into the shadowed forest as TRUDY banks in a search pattern.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . Grace looks to the west.    The sun setting behind alien trees.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Grace stares into the dark forest as the Samson banks hard, thundering away toward the setting sun.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to have to call it, guys. We're not allowed to run night ops. Colonel's orders.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Shit.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Doc. He's just gonna have to hang on `till morning.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: He's not going to make it till morning.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . The giant planet rises behind the black trees. Jake's got a new problem. He sees shapes moving with liquid grace in the NIGHT shadows behind him. He is being stalked by a pack of VIPERWOLVES. Jake catches only glimpses -- a glint of eyes, a slinking black movement -- then nothing. Darkness.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake's hands as he knots his T-shirt around the butt end of the spear.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: trickling down a tree-trunk. Jake jams the makeshift torch into the sap, soaking the shirt with it.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: from his survival kit lights the torch. The torch creates a pool of light surrounded by pulsing, leaping shadows. Jake turns warily as he moves along the trail. Behind him are several pairs of reflective green EYES. Another pair flanking him beside the trail. Black-on-black

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: which seem to flow like liquid. He looks up -- sees one cross a limb overhead.   Another on his opposite flank. Then a hideous sound, like a hyena's psychotic LAUGH. The VIPERWOLVES can run like a dog and climb like a monkey. They are hunting Jake from the ground and the trees.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: by torch-light, on the edge of panic. He reaches a steep banked stream and -- without thinking -- runs across it on a horizontal trunk -- -- and STOPS DEAD on the other side. The torch illuminates

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: cutting ahead of him across the trail. The viperwolves have him encircled. The psychotic BARKS become more intense as they signal each other, getting excited. ONE MAKES A RUN at him, angling on his legs from behind but -- JAKE WHIRLS, jamming the torch in its face.   It yips and goes past, but ANOTHER moves in -- He jabs it with the business end of the spear and it SNARLS, retreating, baring its fangs. Now half a dozen are circling him in the open, and he sees what he's up against.   The VIPERWOLVES are six-limbed with shiny chitinous skin, their paws leathery BLACK HANDS. Intelligent eyes. Glistening black teeth in dead white gums. Jake realizes that he is making his final stand.   He whirls the torch in an arc, keeping them at bay -- And feels a rush of adrenaline. It goes through him like a lightning bolt and the fear is gone.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: With snarls and a blur of motion THEY ATTACK. Jake CRACKS the spear down on one, then SPINS as -- ANOTHER LEAPS at him and he plants the spear in it, striking true, but -- Its momentum wrenches it from his hands, and the torch goes flying. Left in semi-darkness, Jake draws his KNIFE as--

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I don't have all goddamn night! Come on! Come on!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: sinking its teeth into his arm. He YELLS in pain and fury, SLASHING with the knife which -- CUTS deep into the beast's shoulder and it lets go.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: trying to escape, but a snarling viperwolf leaps, GRABBING him by the ankle with its fore-hand. Jake tears away, sprawling, SCRAMBLING to get up as -- 38.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: charge at once.     The nearest LEAPS at his throat just as -- THUNK!! -- an ARROW appears in its chest. The wolf lands on him, already a dead weight.    He pushes it off in time to see -- A BLUE AMAZON emerge from the trees, nock another arrow, draw and FIRE in one fluid motion. AN UNEARTHLY YOWL as another wolf falls.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: right over Jake, and CRACKS her bow down on the skull of a circling wolf.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: at her and she drops under its weight, but rolls, coming up on top of it with a knife in her hand. Her knife FLASHES down, buried to the hilt in its chest.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: a wounded wolf attacks Jake, and he KICKS it away, but -- It SPINS and leaps back onto him, and Jake barely catches its throat in time to keep the SNAPPING JAWS away from his face.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri swings her bow in a big arc, CRACKING IT across the heads and shoulders of two remaining wolves.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The wolves slink and circle, yelping as the bow whistles past them. Finally they break and run, with Neytiri chasing and-- They bound away through the foliage as she SHOUTS after them--

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake has his adversary pinned and is choking it with all his weight. Finally it stops thrashing. Panting, he releases it and looks up at -- NEYTIRI. Her tail LASHES as she scans the forest, listening to the fading YELPS of the wolves. Satisfied the attack is over, she turns. She regards him coldly for a second, then walks past him. Neytiri picks up the torch and extinguishes it in a stream.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake blinks around at the darkness -- realizing he can still see. In fact, with the blinding torchlight gone, the forest is transformed. The jungle has come alive with BIOLUMINESCENCE -- spots and patterns, ghosts and galaxies of blue-green light. Jake scrambles to recover his spear.   Neytiri kneels beside -- A DYING WOLF. It's CRIES are pitiful. It paws the air, trying to raise its head. She pulls her KNIFE from its chest.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She cuts its throat, ending the pitiful cries. She touches its head gently, regarding it with sadness. Neytiri wipes the knife and returns it to the sheath at her waist. She crosses to another slain wolf and kneels, pulling the arrow from its heart.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri ignores him, assuming a prayer posture over the dead animal.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She rises and walks away without looking at Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He crashes through some plants, catching up to her.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He makes the mistake of grasping her shoulder and -- 40.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Rrreeyaaah! Hyaaaah!!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Raaaarrrr!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Wait, don't -- 39.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (in Na'vi) Forgive me, my brother.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Look, um, I know you probably don't understand this. But -- thanks. Thank you. I owe you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (in Na'vi) Forgive me. May your spirit run with the Great Mother.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I would have been screwed if you hadn't come along --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Hey, wait. Wait!   Where you goin'?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Slow down a second will you. I just want to thank you for killing those --

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ! She WALLOPS him upside the head with her bow in a fierce backhand swing, laying him out flat. He looks up to see a FURY standing over him. A Fury who speaks English -- accented, halting, angry English.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She gestures at the bodies of the viperwolves.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She silences him with the tip of her bow at his throat.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake gets up, slowly, facing her.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Don't thank! You don't thank for this! This is sad. Very sad, only.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Okay, I'm sorry.    Whatever I did -- I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: All this is your fault! They did not need to die.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: They attacked me.   How'm I the bad guy

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Your fault! You are like a baby, making noise, don't know what to do. You should not come here, all of you! You only come and make problems. Only.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Okay, fine, you love your little forest friends. So why not just let them kill my ass? What's the thinking?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri -- looking away. Finally, reluctantly, her eyes

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: for the first time -- a riveting gaze with those big gold orbs.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She leans closer -- 41.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She turns away, stalking off, but Jake goes after her.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why save you?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yes, why save me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You have a strong heart.   No fear.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: But stupid! Ignorant like a child!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: WITH Neytiri as she climbs nimbly along a huge ROOT.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: R as she trots with perfect balance along the root, which forms an elevated walkway. Jake runs to catch up, realizing suddenly that he is far above the forest floor. Throughout the following they move through a GLOWING PHANTASMAGORICAL FOREST.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She leaps to another elevated root.   Jake follows, surprised that he made it.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He runs to catch up with her easy jogging pace.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She stops and he almost runs into her.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Then she turns and trots on.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: If I'm so ignorant, maybe you should teach me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Sky people can not learn.   You do not See.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Whooaa.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Then teach me to "see."

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No one can teach you to See.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: They run across the elevated root of an enormous tree -- a horizontal trunk big as an oak.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: as they cross a DEEP GORGE. A waterfall shimmers silver in the Polyphemus-light. Vines hang down a hundred feet into the gorge, and among them swoop stingbats and other night flyers.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake looks down, suddenly aware of the height.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: A vine catches his spear and spins him off balance.   He drops the spear and almost falls off the root.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri catches him with one hand, gripping his bicep. He watches the spear cartwheel down to splash in the river. She pulls him upright. Shouts at him in English and Na'vi.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Hey, slow down. Look, I think we just got off on the wrong foot and -- 42.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: --you just have to get to know me. I'm Jake. Jake Sull--

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Whooaaa -- shit!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I need your help.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You should not be here.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So take me with you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No. You go back.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: several WOODSPRITES float down through the trees. FOLLOW THEM as they descend silently toward Jake and Neytiri.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: sensing a presence, looks up to see -- The WOODSPRITES, PULSING with purpose, float right towards Jake. They dance gently around his shoulders and head.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: More woodsprites gather around him.   Several ALIGHT on him. Jake holds still, knowing he should be afraid -- but somehow he's not. He spreads his arms. More sprites come, landing all over his arms, hands, body.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (off her amazed look) What?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What are they?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: reacting with a mixture of wonder and dread.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake -- now a pulsing, glowing, fluttering MASS OF LIGHT -- moves one hand slowly, not wanting to break the spell. He studies one of the sprites dancing on his palm until -- -- WHOOSSHH! the woodsprites whirl up and away, scattering into the darkness.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri seems shaken.   She seizes his hand and pulls him after her.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Atokirina'. Seeds of the Great Tree -- very pure spirits.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What was that all about?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Come!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: as he gazes about him in growing wonder. He touches leaves as he passes, watching the bioluminescence shiver through them. Jake looks down as -- they cross a bed of purple MOSS which reacts to the pressure of their footsteps. Rings of green light, like ripples on a pond, expand outward from each footfall. Exploding rings of light where his feet touch down. Dream-like, surreal beauty.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: as they run over a large root, across a mirror- like POOL at the base of a WATERFALL. Jake follows Neytiri, running along a raised root-trunk.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What's your name?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: hears WHOOSH-WHOOSH and snaps a look as a BOLO flies at him, spinning end for end and -- SHWHAP!! -- tangles around his legs.   He topples off the root and crashes into the foliage below.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: untangles himself, getting up to run just as -- SEVERAL NA'VI RIDERS thunder toward him. They are riding

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: six-legged, armor-skinned alien Clydesdales.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . We see that the riders' QUEUES are connected to the horses' long moth-like antennae -- a neural-link with which they can command the horse, leaving hands free for weapons. The riders aim bows and spears at Jake as they approach. Jake turns to bolt, but -- NA'VI HUNTERS melt out of the shadows, weapons aimed -- blocking his retreat. Neytiri drops to the ground next to Jake and confronts the

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . She shouts sharply in Na'vi -- NEYTIRI (SUBTITLED) Tsu'tey, what are you doing?! He is my captive!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: (tsu-Tay)is young and powerfully built, with sculpted features and a proud jawline, piercing eyes. Tsu'tey swings off his mount with fluid grace.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Tsu'tey draws his bow but Neytiri leaps between him and Jake, confronting him warrior to warrior.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Tsu'tey clenches his jaw with frustration -- frustration with her as much as the situation. He turns and angrily remounts his direhorse, barking a command to the HUNTERS.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: They grab Jake and haul him to his feet. Encircled by spears and bows, he is shoved forward along the trail, as Tsu'tey and the others ride ahead.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: These demons are forbidden here. I will kill this one as a lesson to the others!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Stop! There has been a sign. This is a matter for the Tsahik.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Bring him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: is hauled roughly toward Neytiri's village, which is sheltered inside one of the GREAT TREES. HOMETREE is 250 meters tall, with a trunk four times the diameter of the largest Sequoia, and a base of massive mangrove-pillars.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: rides inside the columns at the base of Hometree, shouting an ululating WARNING. Jake is force-marched through the pillars into -- INT. COMMONS/HOMETREE - NIGHT An open CENTRAL AREA. The villagers gather to see the arriving hunt party. We see the people of the tribe -- mothers with babies, old women, young hunters. They gawk at the alien, expressions ranging from curiosity to outright hostility. The huge eyes of the children follow him. Jake is amazed at the size of HOMETREE inside. By the light of the COOK-FIRES he can see up into a vast cylindrical gallery -- a living cathedral. Clear membranes -- sturmbeest bladders -- filled with fluttering bio-luminescent insects, act as area lighting. The central space is dominated by the SKULL of some enormous creature, mounted with much embellishment on a TOTEM. Standing in front of this, awaiting their approach, is -- EYTUKAN (AY-too-kahn), the Clan Leader. Eytukan has deeply chiselled features and a long chest mantle of THANATOR CLAWS. His normally stern features are clouded further by anger.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri addresses Eytukan in Na'vi.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He glowers at her as he responds, pointing at Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri stands her ground, answering in a respectful but not submissive tone.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake steps forward, offering his hand, and the hunters JUMP to restrain him, shouting. But they all FREEZE as -- A commanding FEMALE VOICE echoes through the chamber.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Everybody looks up.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why do you bring this creature here?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I was going to kill him, but there was a sign from Eywa.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I have said no dreamwalker will come here, to offend our home! His alien smell fills my nose

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Father, many atokirina came to this alien.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What's going on?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: My father is deciding whether to kill you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Your father!? (to Eytukan) Uh, good to meet you, sir.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Step back!

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: (MOH-aht) stands on the second level, looking down. She is a severe woman in her 50's. Her bearing is haughty, her expression friendly as a hanging-judge. Her outfit is elaborate, denoting her rank as CLAN MATRIARCH.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: There is an expectant hush as Mo'at descends the helical core of Hometree, a kind of natural spiral staircase.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri kneels before her like an acolyte as Mo'at passes. The villagers stare silently as the Matriarch circles slowly around Jake, examining his tail and the end of his queue.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She produces a long THORN between her fingertips. With a flourish she strikes his chest. Jake flinches. RED BLOOD wells up and Mo'at rubs some between her fingertips. She tastes it.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I will look at this alien.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That is Mother. She is Tsahik -- the one who interprets the will of Eywa.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who's Eywa?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (thick accent) What are you called?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Jake Sully.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why did you come to us?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I came to learn.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: We have tried to teach other Sky People. It is hard to fill a cup which is already full.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: My cup is empty, trust me. Just ask Doctor Augustine. I'm no scientist.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What are you?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I was a Marine -- uh, a warrior. Of the Jarhead clan.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: A warrior! I could kill him easily!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No! This is the first warrior dreamwalker we have seen. We need to learn more about him.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What's going on?   What are they saying?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (to Neytiri, subtitled) Daughter. You will teach him our way, to speak and walk as we do.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: looks shocked, then angry.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri subsides, turning to glare at Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She turns to Neytiri, her expression stern -- MO'AT (SUBTITLED) He is your responsibility. Neytiri nods, accepting, but she's not a happy camper.   She grabs Jake's arm and pulls him roughly away.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why me? That's not fair!     I only--

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It is decided!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (to Jake) My daughter will teach you our ways. Learn well, Jakesully. We will see if your insanity can be cured.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So it's all good, right?   You and me -- NEYTIRI Do not speak.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . SECOND LEVEL/HOMETREE LATER, Neytiri leads Jake up the spiral to the SECOND LEVEL. He now wears only a ratty LOINCLOTH. His wounds are bound with plant-fiber bandages.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: is squatting at dinner in a huge circle. They stop talking and turn to gaze at Jake as he enters the circle.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Neytiri crosses the circle to the cook pit and returns with several large leaves heaped with food. She kneels next to Jake, placing the food in front of him almost DEFIANTLY.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake knows she's baiting him.   He smiles in response.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Don't get up.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You never told me your name.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Neytiri te Ckaha Mo'at'ite.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Okay, again, a whole lot slower.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (exaggerated slowness) Neytiri. Nay-TEE-ree.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Nay-TEE-ree. That's nice. Nay-TEE-ree.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Tsu'tey, Mo'at and Eytukan sit together, glancing up occasionally from their food to the stranger.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: These aliens try to look like people, but they can't.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: He seems dim to me.   And his eyes are too small.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: motions for Jake to take portions from the serving leaves onto his own leaf.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Your mom likes me.    I can tell.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: watching Jake and Neytiri, leans over to Eytukan.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Jake munches on a white shrimp-like thing.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . Jake blanches. She heaps some more onto his leaf -- a

She stares at him for a moment, then closes her eyes. Jake watches the glowing bugs fluttering inside a night- light, a pulse of life energy. A strange peace spreads through him. He closes his eyes and -- CUT TO:

direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Wha --? Oh.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Damn, you were dug in like a tick. (she helps him sit up) Is the avatar safe?

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: so the kid's out there one night and he's got the Queen Bitch herself offering him the spare room and the car keys. Unbelievable.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's not something you can teach.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's awesome, Jake.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: chomps his bacon, fuming.

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. They want to study me.   See if I can learn to be one of them.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's how you seize the initiative. I wish I had ten more like you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Look, Sully -- find out what these blue monkeys want. (MORE)

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) We try to give them medicine and education. Roads! But no -- they like mud. I wouldn't care except --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Their damn village is sitting right over the richest unobtanium deposit for a hundred klicks in any direction. Which sucks -- for them -- because they need to relocate.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (taking that in) Does Augustine know about this?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, she does, and she's on the next ship back if she tries to cock-block me on it.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So -- who talks them into moving?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Guess.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What if they won't go?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm betting they will.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Killing the indigenous looks bad, but there's one thing shareholders hate more than bad press -- and that's a bad quarterly statement. Find me a carrot to get them to move, or it's going to have to be all stick.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You got three months.    That's when the dozers get there.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm on it.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Got it. So who's this Eywa?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who's Eywa? Oh, only their deity. The Great Mother. The goddess made up of all living things. You'd know that if you had any training whatsoever.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Knock it off. Jesus, it's like kindergarten around here.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Neytiri was my best student. She and her sister Silwanin. Just amazing girls.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I didn't meet the sister.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No, she's dead. (turning to him) Okay, let's go -- village life starts early.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Link is ready.

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's not our choice, Norm.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well I didn't come out here to wash the dishes while you're on some interspecies booty call.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: He can't go far.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Let's get you in.

A leathery FWHOOP, like the crack of sails, as it alights on the branch right in front of her.

dialogue.name: dialogue

Jake stares at the strange and wild alien tableau.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

An ugly, stick-like LIZARD-THING perched on a frond. As he approaches -- SNAP! A long spine whips in a circle, unfurling a bioluminescent membrane -- a disk a meter across, opening like a Chinese fan. It FLIES OFF, a living Frisbee.

direction.name: direction
